intro: Maprounea guianensis var. nervosa, commonly known as the Guianan mapou, is a deciduous tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
